alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Prairie; White; Woodruff (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 7:59AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Woodruff, northeastern Prairie, northwestern Monroe and southeastern White Counties through 830 AM CDT... At 759 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Augusta to 9 miles south of Hurricane Lake WMA to 6 miles northwest of Des Arc. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brinkley... Augusta... Des Arc... Clarendon... Patterson... Fredonia... Hunter... Alfrey... Allendale... Dobbs Landing... Peppers Landing... McCrory... Hurricane Lake WMA... Pryor... Cotton Plant... Fargo... Becton... Howell... Penrose... McClelland... This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 199 and 218. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
